inputs.description: Specify the tractography algorithm to use. Valid choices are: FACT, iFOD1, iFOD2, Nulldist1, Nulldist2, SD_Stream, Seedtest, Tensor_Det, Tensor_Prob (default: iFOD2).
inputs.name: algorithm

inputs.description: Set the desired number of streamlines to be selected by tckgen, after all selection criteria have been applied (i.e. inclusion/exclusion ROIs, min/max length, etc). tckgen will keep seeding streamlines until this number of streamlines have been selected, or the maximum allowed number of seeds has been exceeded (see -seeds option). By default, 5000 streamlines are to be selected. Set to zero to disable, which will result in streamlines being seeded until the number specified by -seeds has been reached.
inputs.name: select

inputs.description: Set the step size of the algorithm in mm (default is 0.1 x voxelsize).
inputs.name: Default step

inputs.description: Set the step size of the algorithm in mm (default for iFOD2: 0.5 x voxelsize).
inputs.name: iFOD2 step

inputs.description: Set the maximum angle between successive steps (default is 90deg x stepsize / voxelsize).
inputs.name: angle

inputs.description: Set the minimum length of any track in mm (default is 2 x voxelsize with ACT).
inputs.name: minlength with ACT

inputs.description: Set the minimum length of any track in mm (default is 5 x voxelsize without ACT).
inputs.name: minlength

inputs.description: Set the maximum length of any track in mm (default is 100 x voxelsize).
inputs.name: maxlength

inputs.description: Set the FOD amplitude / fixel size / tensor FA cutoff for terminating tracks (defaults are: 0.05 for FOD-based algorithms; 0.05 for fixel-based algorithms; 0.1 for tensor-based algorithms).
inputs.name: FOD cutoff

inputs.description: Set the FOD amplitude / fixel size / tensor FA cutoff for terminating tracks (defaults are: 0.05 for FOD-based algorithms; 0.05 for fixel-based algorithms; 0.1 for tensor-based algorithms).
inputs.name: Fixel cutoff

inputs.description: Set the FOD amplitude / fixel size / tensor FA cutoff for terminating tracks (defaults are: 0.05 for FOD-based algorithms; 0.05 for fixel-based algorithms; 0.1 for tensor-based algorithms).
inputs.name: Tensor cutoff

inputs.description: Set the maximum number of sampling trials at each point (only used for probabilistic tracking).
inputs.name: trials

inputs.description: Do NOT pre-compute legendre polynomial values. Warning: this will slow down the algorithm by a factor of approximately 4.
inputs.name: noprecomputed

inputs.description: Use 4th-order Runge-Kutta integration (slower, but eliminates curvature overshoot in 1st-order deterministic methods)
inputs.name: rk4

inputs.description: Stop propagating a streamline once it has traversed all include regions
inputs.name: stop

inputs.description: Downsample the generated streamlines to reduce output file size (default is no downsampling, except iFOD2)
inputs.name: downsample

inputs.description: Downsample the generated streamlines to reduce output file size (default is (samples-1) for iFOD2)
inputs.name: downsample for iFOD2

inputs.description: Seed streamlines entirely at random within a mask image
inputs.name: seed_image

inputs.description: Spherical seed as four comma-separated values (XYZ position and radius)
inputs.name: seed_sphere

inputs.description: Seed a fixed number of streamlines per voxel in a mask image; random placement of seeds in each voxel
inputs.name: seed_random_per_voxel

inputs.description: Seed a fixed number of streamlines per voxel in a mask image; random placement of seeds in each voxel
inputs.name: Streamlines number per voxel

inputs.description: Seed a fixed number of streamlines per voxel in a mask image; place seeds on a 3D mesh grid (grid_size argument is per axis; so a grid_size of 3 results in 27 seeds per voxel)
inputs.name: seed_grid_per_voxel

inputs.description: Seed a fixed number of streamlines per voxel in a mask image; place seeds on a 3D mesh grid (grid_size argument is per axis; so a grid_size of 3 results in 27 seeds per voxel)
inputs.name: 3D Seeds mesh grid

inputs.description: Seed from an image using rejection sampling (higher values = more probable to seed from)
inputs.name: seed_rejection

inputs.description: Seed from the grey matter - white matter interface (only valid if using ACT framework). Input image should be a 3D seeding volume; seeds drawn within this image will be optimised to the interface using the 5TT image provided using the -act option.
inputs.name: seed_gmwmi

inputs.description: Ddetermine seed points dynamically using the SIFT model (must not provide any other seeding mechanism). Note that while this seeding mechanism improves the distribution of reconstructed streamlines density, it should NOT be used as a substitute for the SIFT method itself.
inputs.name: seed_dynamic

inputs.description: Set the number of seeds that tckgen will attempt to track from. If this option is NOT provided, the default number of seeds is set to 1000Ã— the number of selected streamlines. If -select is NOT also specified, tckgen will continue tracking until this number of seeds has been attempted. However, if -select is also specified, tckgen will stop when the number of seeds attempted reaches the number specified here, OR when the number of streamlines selected reaches the number requested with the -select option. This can be used to prevent the program from running indefinitely when no or very few streamlines can be found that match the selection criteria. Setting this to zero will cause tckgen to keep attempting seeds until the number specified by -select has been reached.
inputs.name: seeds

inputs.description: Set the maximum number of times that the tracking algorithm should attempt to find an appropriate tracking direction from a given seed point. This should be set high enough to ensure that an actual plausible seed point is not discarded prematurely as being unable to initiate tracking from. Higher settings may affect performance if many seeds are genuinely impossible to track from, as many attempts will still be made in vain for such seeds. (default: 1000)
inputs.name: Maximum attempts per seed

inputs.description: Set the minimum FA or FOD amplitude for seeding tracks (default is the same as the normal -cutoff).
inputs.name: Seed cutoff

inputs.description: Track from the seed point in one direction only (default is to track in both directions).
inputs.name: Seed unidirectionally

inputs.description: Specify a seeding direction for the tracking (this should be supplied as a vector of 3 comma-separated values.
inputs.name: Seed direction

inputs.description: Output the seed location of all successful streamlines to a file
inputs.name: output_seeds

inputs.description: Specify an inclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image. Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion regions to be accepted.
inputs.name: include binary mask region

inputs.description: Specify an inclusion region of interest, as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines must traverse ALL inclusion regions to be accepted.
inputs.name: include sphere region

inputs.description: Specify an exclusion region of interest, as either a binary mask image. Streamlines that enter ANY exclude region will be discarded.
inputs.name: exclude binary mask region

inputs.description: Specify an exclusion region of interest, as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). Streamlines that enter ANY exclude region will be discarded.
inputs.name: exclude sphere region

inputs.description: Specify a masking region of interest, as either a binary mask image. If defined, streamlines exiting the mask will be truncated.
inputs.name: mask binary mask region

inputs.description: Specify a masking region of interest, as a sphere using 4 comma-separared values (x,y,z,radius). If defined, streamlines exiting the mask will be truncated.
inputs.name: mask sphere region

inputs.description: Use the Anatomically-Constrained Tractography framework during tracking; provided image must be in the 5TT (five-tissue-type) format
inputs.name: act

inputs.description: Allow tracks to be truncated and re-tracked if a poor structural termination is encountered
inputs.name: backtrack

inputs.description: Crop streamline endpoints more precisely as they cross the GM-WM interface
inputs.name: crop_at_gmwmi

inputs.description: Set the number of FOD samples to take per step (Default: 4)
inputs.name: samples

inputs.description: Raise the FOD to the power specified (default is 1/nsamples).
inputs.name: power

inputs.description: Provide the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in a text file. This should be supplied as a 4xN text file with each line is in the format [ X Y Z b ], where [ X Y Z ] describe the direction of the applied gradient, and b gives the b-value in units of s/mm^2. If a diffusion gradient scheme is present in the input image header, the data provided with this option will be instead used.
inputs.name: grad

inputs.description: Provide the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in FSL bvecs/bvals format files. If a diffusion gradient scheme is present in the input image header, the data provided with this option will be instead used.
inputs.name: fslgrad

inputs.description: Specify the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in FSL bvecs format.
inputs.name: bvecs

inputs.description: Specify the diffusion-weighted gradient scheme used in the acquisition in FSL bvals format.
inputs.name: bvals

inputs.description: Specifies whether the b-values should be scaled by the square of the corresponding DW gradient norm, as often required for multi-shell or DSI DW acquisition schemes. The default action can also be set in the MRtrix config file, under the BValueScaling entry. Valid choices are yes/no, true/false, 0/1 (default: true).
inputs.name: bvalue_scaling

inputs.description: Display information messages.
inputs.name: info

inputs.description: Do not display information messages or progress status.
inputs.name: quiet

inputs.description: Display debugging messages.
inputs.name: debug

inputs.description: Force overwrite of output files. Caution: Using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour.
inputs.name: force

inputs.description: Use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading)
inputs.name: nthreads

inputs.description: Display this information page and exit
inputs.name: help

inputs.description: Display version information and exit
inputs.name: version

inputs.description: The image containing the source data. The type of image data required depends on the algorithm used (see Description section).
inputs.name: source

inputs.description: The output file containing the tracks generated.
inputs.name: Tracks generated

output-files.name: Tracks output
output-files.description: The output file containing the tracks generated.

output-files.name: Seed location
output-files.description: Seed location of all successful streamlines
